title: Book Talk with Iris Bohnet
dateTime: Tuesday, July 22 2025 at 12:00 PM EDT to Tuesday, July 22 2025 at 1:00 PM EDT Add To Google Calendar | iCal/Outlook
location: Online Online Location Online Location Instructions Please register for Zoom information.
description:
Book Talk with Iris Bohnet
 
Lectures • Virtual Radcliffe Book Talks
Tuesday, July 22, 2025
12 PM ET
Online on Zoom
 
The second installment in our series features Iris Bohnet, coauthor of Make Work Fair: Data-Driven Design for Real Results (Harper Business Press, 2025) with Siri Chilazi. A behavioral economist and leading voice on equity in the workplace, Bohnet advises governments and companies around the world.
 
For more information and to register, please visit:

title: Farmers' Market at Harvard
dateTime: Tuesday, July 22 2025 at 11:30 AM EDT to Tuesday, July 22 2025 at 5:30 PM EDT Add To Google Calendar | iCal/Outlook
location: Science Center Plaza 1 Oxford St., Cambridge, MA View Map
description:
Grab your shopping bag and join us at the farmers' market every Tuesday through October 28th, 11:30 a.m. - 5:30 p.m. Help support the vital local farmers and food artisans who ensure we have fresh, healthy food!
Stop by for lemonade, local mushrooms, early summer produce, eggs, microgreens, freshly baked bread, cookies, iced coffee, and more!
The market accepts SNAP with a weekly maximum SNAP Match of $15.
Participating vendors also accept HIP, WIC and Senior FMNP Coupons.

title: Productivity to PhD (Additional Session Added!!)
dateTime: Monday, July 14 2025 at 1:00 PM EDT to Friday, July 25 2025 at 2:30 PM EDT Add To Google Calendar | iCal/Outlook
location: Online Online Location Join Event Online Online Location Instructions To join the group and receive the Zoom links for each session, please register through the ARC Scheduler.
description:
Additional Session Added!!  
 
Do you want to make significant progress to your prospectus, dissertation, or other research or writing project this summer? With a wide-open schedule and reduced social support, how can you be sure you will get down to work each day? Easy! Register for Productivity to PhD, set a goal, and join us for two weeks of daily jump starts!
An academic coach and a small group of doctoral students will meet every weekday morning for shared structure, accountability, and encouragement. At each session, after a brief check-in to review the prior day’s progress and set goals for the work hour, each student will work independently on- or off-line for 60 minutes. The group will then reconvene at 2:15 p.m. to share progress, troubleshoot as needed, and set goals for the rest of the day. Participants are also encouraged to share wins, challenges, and strategies for success.
 
Meets from 1:00 p.m. to 2:30 p.m. every weekday from July 14 through July 25.  Register in advance through the Academic Resource Center Scheduler.
Upon registration, you will receive an email with Zoom links for each day.
 
Daily attendance is suggested for group accountability. Open to all Harvard Griffin GSAS students.

title: Game Guild - Heavy Game Night
dateTime: Friday, July 25 2025 at 6:00 PM EDT to Friday, July 25 2025 at 9:30 PM EDT Add To Google Calendar | iCal/Outlook
location: Lehman Hall - Room 204 (Grad Student Lounge) 8 Harvard Yard View Map
description:
Greetings fellow adventurers! Game Guild returns with our heavy game night, featuring deeper games of strategy and adventure! Heavy games often require greater investment to learn and play. All our welcome to enjoy these more involved offerings beyond our general open boardgame night!
WHEN 6pm - 9:30pm on Fridays. Please see the event for the specific date.
WHERE Lehman Room 204 (Graduate Student Lounge).
 
All are welcome! Please sign up beforehand to help coordinate games. Feel free to join our Discord for game night discussions.
 
More upcoming events are posted on our calendar!
 
Join our Engage group for up-to-date communication on Guild news, leadership opportunities, pilot programs, and other exciting adventures! To join, ensure you're signed in to Engage, then press the "Join" button on the upper right.
host: Game Guild, a Harvard Griffin GSAS Student Group
